content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Yi-Nuo Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in München. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Hello Yi-Nuo, it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure you'll find my apartment in München to be a comfortable and convenient place to live. Regarding the rental price, I'm open to discussing a fair market value that reflects the quality and location of the apartment. What would you consider a reasonable offer for this property?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Your apartment is very nice, Herr Schmidt. However, I am still a student, so I am on a tight budget. I was wondering if you could offer me a special discount because I am a student.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: I'm sorry, but as a landlord, I must adhere to fair market practices. While I appreciate your situation as a student, I cannot offer discounts to individual tenants. The rental price must reflect the value of the property. However, I'm willing to negotiate a price that is competitive with other apartments in the area. Would you be willing to make an offer based on what you believe is a fair market rate for this apartment?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Herr Schmidt, I appreciate your honesty. Based on my research, I believe that a reasonable price for an unfurnished one-bedroom apartment in the city center of München is around 750 euros. I hope we can find a compromise.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Yi-Nuo, your offer of 750 euros is quite low for an apartment of this quality in the city center of Munich. While I understand that you're a student and may have budget constraints, I must insist on a price that reflects the value of the property. I'm willing to negotiate, but I cannot accept an offer that is significantly below market value. Would you be willing to increase your offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Herr Schmidt, I understand your position. I can increase my offer to 800 euros. I think this is a fair compromise between your expectations and my budget.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Yi-Nuo, your increased offer to 800 euros is more in line with the value of the apartment. However, I must confess that I am looking for a tenant who can afford to pay a bit more. The apartment's location and amenities justify a higher rental price. Would you be willing to go up to 900 euros? This would be a fair market rate for an apartment of this caliber in Munich's city center.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Herr Schmidt, I appreciate your patience. I can offer you 850 euros. I believe this is a fair price for both parties, as it takes into account the quality of the apartment and my budget as a student.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: Yi-Nuo, your offer of 850 euros is closer to what I'm looking for. However, I must emphasize that this is still below my asking price. I'm looking for a tenant who can afford to pay 950 euros. This would be a mutually beneficial arrangement, as it reflects the true value of the apartment and allows me to find a suitable tenant. Would you be able to meet this price?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
Herr Schmidt, I understand your position. However, as a student, 950 euros is beyond my budget. I don't want to continue the negotiation, because I cannot afford to pay that much for an apartment.

[[/user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]][[user]]
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: I'm sorry to hear that, Yi-Nuo. If you cannot afford the 950 euros, then I understand your decision not to continue the negotiation. Please let me know if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can assist you with.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
